message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE 

The paper deals with designing a computer-vision based automatic threat recognition (ATR) system for airport baggage screening. This involves image processing, pattern recognition, and machine learning techniques, which are all part of the computer vision field (cs.CV). The paper also discusses the need for adapting the ATR system to changing threat specifications, which involves optimizing the system's performance using feedback from real-world data. This falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper deals with the issue of false positives and false negatives in threat detection, which is a common problem in security systems and falls under the category of computer security and cryptography (cs.CR). Finally, the paper proposes a two-stage cascaded approach for threat recognition, which involves optimizing the system's performance using feedback from real-world data. This approach involves using neural networks and other machine learning techniques, which are part of the field of neural networks (cs.NE).
